From DÃ¼sseldorf to Texas â€“ A Legacy Forged in Steel
It all began in 1913, when LINDEMANN launched its first baler press in DÃ¼sseldorf. What followed was more than a century of innovation, engineering excellence, and a growing global footprint.
One of the defining milestones came in 1958, when LINDEMANN delivered the worldâ€™s first hydraulically operated scrap shear â€“ a 1,200-ton powerhouse â€“ to Luria Brothers, then the largest scrap company in the United States.
Developed in cooperation with Lake Erie, a hydraulics company based in Buffalo, this groundbreaking machine marked the beginning of the hydraulic scrap shear era in North America. Many more followed, helping shape an entire industry.
Fast forward to the early 1980s, when the next chapter began:
The story of Texas Shredder took off in San Antonio, Texas, starting with spare parts and consumables for shredders. By 1986, the first Texas Shredder was delivered to Southern Iron & Metal in Beaumont, TX.
Since then, nearly 120 shredders have been built and installedâ€”most of them in North Americaâ€”solidifying the Texas Shredder name as a symbol of heavy-duty reliability.
Today, that legacy continues in products like the TXS 69x90 modular shredder, combining decades of proven experience with the smart performance needed for tomorrowâ€™s scrap processing.
From DÃ¼sseldorf to Texas â€“ and far beyond â€“ LINDEMANN continues to shape the future of metal recycling with deep roots, bold ideas, and strong customer partnerships.

Today marks the anniversary of the February 6 earthquake, and

Today marks the anniversary of the February 6 earthquake, and we remember with respect and compassion those who lost their lives. We extend our deepest condolences to their families and wish them strength and resilience. The pain of this great disaster remains in our hearts, reminding us once again of the importance of unity and solidarity.

Facing the reality of earthquakes and taking necessary precautions is crucial to preventing similar tragedies in the future. We must continue to raise awareness, be prepared for disasters, and take the necessary measures to ensure a safer tomorrow.

Today is not only a day of remembrance for those we lost but also a day to reflect, learn, and commit to building a safer future.

One significant improvement introduced six years ago is the use of HUNGER brand seal housings in our guided guillotine shearing systems. The Ariete Ecological Press combines the capacity of a powerful and strong compaction with an extremely easy possibility of movement.

Thanks to the use of special high-performance steels, a solid structure with a low weight is created that allows for easy transport via trucks equipped with a Roll on-off device.

The Ariete Ecological Press can be equipped with its own loader for loading and unloading operations and can also have radio control and automatic cycle devices. The Ariete Ecological Press is specifically designed to compact:

Cars,
Metal,
Metal scrap.
